etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, 'word') + phonetic: 𠯑(𠯑) -> word-related meaning with phonetic hint -> final form
etymology.interpretation: The character 话(話) (huà, 'word; speech') uses 言(言) (yán, 'word') to emphasize its association with speech or language, while 𠯑 provides the phonetic component, ensuring the pronunciation aligns with the intended word-related meaning.
etymology.simplification: 话(話) replaces the more complex phonetic 𠯑 with 舌(舌) (shé, 'tongue'), a phonetic that resembles the original in sound, reflecting phonetic and semantic changes.

examples.chinese: 他的话真诚动人(他的話真誠動人)。
examples.english: His words are sincere and moving.

examples.chinese: 他说起话来(他說起話來)，就能打动人心(就能打動人心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō qǐ huà lái, jiù néng dǎdòng rénxīn.
examples.english: When he speaks, he can touch people's hearts.

examples.chinese: 她只选择信任的话(她只選擇信任的話)，而不相信谣言(而不相信謠言)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ xuǎnzé xìnrèn de huà, ér bù xiāngxìn yáoyán.
examples.english: She only believes in trustworthy words, not in rumors.
